result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Willow Grimmenga

records.addlTxt:
[ae] cases 22CF258 and 22CF393 called 8:33 AM Defendant Willow Grimmenga in court, in custody.  Attorney Jessica A Klein in court.  Attorney Theresa A Beck in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Parties advise that they are prepared to proceed with Preliminary Hearing in case 22CF393. Status Conference held in case 22CF258

Officer Kathryn Reidl -sworn & testifies
--direct examination by ADA Beck
       --State's Exhibit #1 [copy of signed bond] offered and received
--cross examination by Attorney Klein

Closing argument given by ADA Beck. Atty Klein motions for dismissal of case

The Court finds probable cause that Mr. Grimmenga committed a felony. The Court binds him over for Trial.
Parties would like to procced to Arraignment today


--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial.

recess 8:49 am

NEXT:  (1) Status Conference for both cases on 11/14/22 at 3:30 pm
Status conference on October 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

[ma] Cases 22CF258 & 22CF393 called at 2:28 PM 
Defendant Willow Grimmenga in court, in custody.  Attorney Jessica A Klein in court for Willow Grimmenga.  Attorney Monica Hall in court for State of Wisconsin. 

On Defendant's Motion to Modify Bond: 
--Supplemental argument given by Atty Klein
--Argument given by DA Hall

The Court denies motion to modify bond; gives basis. 

Atty Klein requests preliminary hearing be scheduled within time limits
recess: 2:35pm 
NEXT: As to Case 22CF393, Preliminary Hearing on 10/27/22 at 8:30am/ As to Case 22CF258, Status on 10/27/22 at 8:30am
Motion hearing on October 17, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Letter from defendant requesting bail reduction

Pre-trial conference on October 5, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on November 14, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

[ma] Case called at 1:16pm 
Defendant Willow Grimmenga appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Jeffrey De La Rosa on behalf of Attorney Klein who has been appointed by SPD.  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

The Court reviews court record. 

Bond Arguments given by Counsel.

Address verified.

The Court modifies bond to $2000 CASH, with conditions to continue. 

recess 1:24  pm. 

NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 10/5/22 at 10:00am   (2) Status Conference on 11/14/22 at 3:30pm

On September 1, 2022 the Court ordered the defendant's signature bond converted to $2500 cash. The defendant was released from jail without posting cash bond on September 5, 2022, as the jail was unaware that the signature bond had been converted to cash. The defendant has failed to either post cash or return to the jail.

Cases 22CF258 and 22CF393 called at 9:40am.  Clerk - CRHI. 
Defendant Willow Grimmenga in court, in custody.  Attorney Jessica A Klein in court for Willow Grimmenga.  Attorney Shock in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court reviews case history, status and filings in both cases. 
Atty. Klein indicates that the SPD will also be appointing her in case 22CF393 but some additional time will be needed for that paperwork to be filed. 

22CF258 ONLY:
Preliminary hearing questionnaire and waiver form submitted.
Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding and intent.  Court accepts the waiver.
Court finds probable cause that the Def. committed a felony and binds the Def. over for arraignment and trial. ARRAIGNMENT:

ARGN:
Information filed.  Service of Information admitted; reading waived.  Maximum penalties recited.  
Not guilty plea entered as to all counts.  
Speedy trial not demanded by either counsel. 

On the Court's own motion, the Court addresses bond in this matter. 
Court presents basis for findings and orders. 
Court modifies its order on bond to a $2500.00CASH BOND with the same conditions as previously ordered. 

BOTH CASES:
Scheduling addressed by the Court and Counsel.  
Cases continued for:
PTC - 10/5/22 at 10am
STC - 11/14/22 at 3:30pm
Recess 9:50am

NEXT: (Notices to be mailed.)
PTC - 10/5/22 at 10am
STC - 11/14/22 at 3:30pm
Preliminary hearing on September 1, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Pre-trial conference on July 6, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

[ml] Case called at 1:40PM
Defendant Willow Grimmenga appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Amber Rumpf (the PD will appoint counsel). Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.

The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
Preliminary Hearing time limit is waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $5,000.00 Signature Bond with conditions:
--no direct or indirect contact with Victim 1, her school, or any place temporarily occupied by the Victim 
--no unsupervised contact with anyone under the age of 18, with the exception of incidental contact while the Defendant attends school
--maintain absolute sobriety
--not leave the State of Wisconsin
--not discuss the facts of the case with Witness 1

The Court directs the Clerk to provide the Defendant with a copy of the Victim/Witness Key along with the bond.

recess 1:48PM

NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 07/06 at 11:00AM with counsel appearances only  (2) Preliminary Hearing on 07/12 at 8:30AM with in person appearances
Proposed Order to Seal Victim Key

Victim Witness Key
The original document name was titled: Victim Witness Key
